Who was responsible for introducing the first practical method of photography known as daguerreotype?
A. George Eastman
B. Thomas Edison
C. Louis Daguerre
D. Alexander Graham Bell

C. Louis Daguerre

The daguerreotype was introduced by Louis Daguerre in 1_slide1839. It was a significant advancement in photography, as it produced highly detailed images on polished silver plates. This method was widely adopted and marked the beginning of commercial photography.
